name: FootnoteOption
shortdesc: Options for specifying default footnote formatting.

property.name: isValid
property.shortdesc: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent of the FootnoteOption &#40;a Application or Document).

property.name: events
property.shortdesc: A collection of events.

property.name: eventListeners
property.shortdesc: A collection of event listeners.

property.name: footnoteNumberingStyle
property.shortdesc: The footnote numbering style. Can return: FootnoteNumberingStyle enumerator or String.

property.name: startAt
property.shortdesc: The number at which to start footnote numbering.

property.name: restartNumbering
property.shortdesc: The point at which to restart footnote numbering. Can return: FootnoteRestarting enumerator or String.

property.name: showPrefixSuffix
property.shortdesc: The position of the footnote prefix and/or suffix. Can return: FootnotePrefixSuffix enumerator or String.

property.name: prefix
property.shortdesc: The prefix text of the footnote. &#40;Limit: 0 to 100 characters)

property.name: suffix
property.shortdesc: The suffix text of the footnote. &#40;Limit: 0 to 100 characters)

property.name: footnoteTextStyle
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style to apply to footnotes. Note: The space before and after the paragraph defined in the paragraph style is ignored for footnotes. To define space above and between footnotes, see spacer and space between.

property.name: footnoteMarkerStyle
property.shortdesc: The character style to apply to footnote reference numbers in the main text.

property.name: markerPositioning
property.shortdesc: The position of footnote reference numbers in the main text. Can return: FootnoteMarkerPositioning enumerator or String.

property.name: separatorText
property.shortdesc: The text to insert between the footnote marker number and the footnote text. &#40;Range: 0 to 100 characters)

property.name: spaceBetween
property.shortdesc: The amount of vertical space between footnotes. Note: The space before and space after defined for the paragraph style applied to the footnote is ignored.

property.name: spacer
property.shortdesc: The minimum amount of vertical space between the bottom of the text column and the first footnote. Note: The space before amount defined in the paragraph style applied to the footnote is ignored for the first footnote.

property.name: footnoteFirstBaselineOffset
property.shortdesc: The distance between the top of the footnote container and the footnote text.

property.name: footnoteMinimumFirstBaselineOffset
property.shortdesc: The minimum distance between the baseline of the text and the top of the footnote container.

property.name: eosPlacement
property.shortdesc: If true, footnotes at the end of the story are placed just below the text. If false, footnotes at the end of the story are placed at the bottom of the column.

property.name: noSplitting
property.shortdesc: If true, footnotes cannot split across columns. If false, footnotes flow into succeeding columns when the footnote text causes the footnote area to expand upward to reach the footnote reference number in the main text.

property.name: ruleOn
property.shortdesc: If true, draws a rule between the text and the first footnote in the column.

property.name: ruleType
property.shortdesc: The stroke type of the rule above the first footnote in a column. Note: Valid when rule on is true. Can return: StrokeStyle or String.

property.name: ruleLineWeight
property.shortdesc: The stroke weight of the rule above the first footnote in the column. &#40;Range: 0 to 1000) Note: Valid when rule on is true.

property.name: ruleColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the stroke of the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule on is true. Can return: Swatch or String.

property.name: ruleGapColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the stroke gap of the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule type is not solid. Can return: Swatch or String.

property.name: ruleTint
property.shortdesc: The tint &#40;as a percentage) of the rule above the first footnote in the column. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when rule on is true.

property.name: ruleGapTint
property.shortdesc: The tint &#40;as a percentage) of the gap color of the rule above the first footnote in the column. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when rule type is not solid.

property.name: ruleGapOverprint
property.shortdesc: If true, overprints the gap color of the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule type is not solid.

property.name: ruleOverprint
property.shortdesc: If true, overprints the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule on is true.

property.name: ruleLeftIndent
property.shortdesc: The amount to left indent the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule on is true.

property.name: ruleWidth
property.shortdesc: The length of the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule on is true.

property.name: ruleOffset
property.shortdesc: The vertical offset of the rule above the first footnote in the column. Note: Valid when rule on is true.

property.name: continuingRuleOn
property.shortdesc: If true, draws a rule above footnote text that continues from a previous column. Note: Valid when no splitting is false or undefined.

property.name: continuingRuleType
property.shortdesc: The stroke type of the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true. Can return: StrokeStyle or String.

property.name: continuingRuleLineWeight
property.shortdesc: The stroke weight of the rule above continued footnote text. &#40;Range: 0 to 1000) Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true.

property.name: continuingRuleColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true. Can return: Swatch or String.

property.name: continuingRuleGapColor
property.shortdesc: The swatch &#40;color, gradient, tint, or mixed ink) applied to the stroke gap of the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule type is not solid. Can return: Swatch or String.

property.name: continuingRuleTint
property.shortdesc: The tint &#40;as a percentage) of the rule above continued footnote text. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when continuing rule type is not solid.

property.name: continuingRuleGapTint
property.shortdesc: The tint &#40;as a percentage) of the gap color of the rule above continued footnote text. (Range: 0 to 100) Note: Valid when continuing rule type is not solid.

property.name: continuingRuleOverprint
property.shortdesc: If true, overprints the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true.

property.name: continuingRuleGapOverprint
property.shortdesc: If true, overprints the gap color of the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule type is not solid.

property.name: continuingRuleLeftIndent
property.shortdesc: The amount to left indent the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true.

property.name: continuingRuleWidth
property.shortdesc: The length of the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true.

property.name: continuingRuleOffset
property.shortdesc: The vertical offset of the rule above continued footnote text. Note: Valid when continuing rule on is true.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the FootnoteOption.

method.name: getElements
method.shortdesc: Resolves the object specifier, creating an array of object references.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The registered event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
